document.title: 23 - 24 CTE Curriculum Frameworks  Engineering & Technology Education (Integrated Technology)

E434FE5CFCF84C1382495160834EDEF2.description: Form an understanding and appreciation for the roles and work of technology workers.

F4B70B00574F4553B67B667307D37B53.description: Form an understanding and appreciation for work after participating in a simulated technology group project in the laboratory.

6CA637E40AE8489AAF574719B50EDCEF.description: Form an understanding and appreciation for work after listening to or observing technology workers.

F56B781E74E444BDB41FFD1F7583C722.description: Explore careers within specific areas of interest.

12716C1F81C2420CA7DEA4AE6C880CC1.description: Identify careers within specific areas of technology.

DB62C526CB1F445699831DF735D8CCB1.description: Discuss individual interests related to a career.

9707D0F1B24E4CB6BBC87875BC557B02.description: Discuss individual interests, aptitudes, and opportunities as they relate to a career.--The student will be able to:

B096FA9EEAB042E68D1AA59DB3CA1FEB.description: Perform roles in a student personnel system or in a career and technical student organization (CTSO).

D4CDC7A8241B4C5FA9D72850A713EC3A.description: Exhibit positive human relations and leadership skills.--The student will be able to:

9288F23ADBB641568740EFFAE4D46357.description: Identify harmful effects/potential dangers of familiar hazardous substances/devices to people and the environment.

DE752B0F5BED4EDCBAB94DC3DA41013D.description: Explain fire prevention and safety precautions and practices for extinguishing fires.

6E28FA5205864F6D8A196D01419EC0C6.description: Safely use hand tools and power equipment.

6B049E6E150E48A8BD425E23E24A1BF5.description: Select appropriate tools, machines, and equipment to accomplish a given task.

EDA90A42DB3445DB83A22D551D614CEE.description: Exercise care and respect for all tools, equipment, and materials.

892FCBCA2CD94F98AD9FCF03F3945BAE.description: Conduct classroom/laboratory activities and equipment operations in a safe manner.

5665994E98B84030A26950475907CDDB.description: Demonstrate good housekeeping at workstations within a classroom/laboratory.

BD337193310944488E89D7E6330910EA.description: Follow classroom/laboratory safety rules and procedures.

C0ECD6A81C9646B4B424A80491851FEF.description: Demonstrate proper and safe procedures while working with technological tools, apparatus, equipment, systems, and materials.--The student will be able to:

F2F7450740AC455E801627C2BE2D500A.description: Classify structures as temporary or permanent.

3AE7318815FE48BFA4D1FE516FB31A40.description: Explain that structures rest on a foundation.

C0B5B7CDD06C479D9DFCE6388F7AE920.description: Identify factors such as style, convenience, cost, climate, and function in the selection of designs for structures.

25BC13D398104AA4BBACB51CB089ADB0.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use construction technologies.--The student will be able to:

DED334B956694C86AB47B6DC141C5D16.description: Explain that materials must first be located before they can be extracted from the earth through processes such as harvesting, drilling, and mining.

F5E2FFC8DCC64BADB6D8741FA2968EE4.description: Describe manufacturing technologies that are used to modify or alter manufactured products.

2E9F1A10A7EA429EAEF19C7B74BB9FD7.description: Employ the manufacturing process including the designing, development, making, and servicing of products and systems.

EA444D0C38B14DBE8DB02F01C1A4A27C.description: Classify manufactured goods as durable and non-durable.

27ECF45277234A50A037434B0A5CB335.description: Describe manufacturing systems using mechanical processes that change the form of materials through processes of separating, forming, combining, and conditioning them.

0A61382848F943399B4D92A19ADF2FE0.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use manufacturing technologies.--The student will be able to:

2FE6DA1B62EF460CAB6477414EF39C84.description: Describe how governmental regulations often influence the design and operation of transportation systems.

FB40AAAF7DCF4B77A72CB7DF3285764B.description: Summarize processes, such as receiving, holding, storing, loading, moving, unloading, delivering, evaluating, marketing, managing, communicating, and using conventions are necessary for the entire transportation system to operate efficiently.

6CB21F39BF62448DB7F6487942BB2AA9.description: Describe subsystems of transportation vehicles, such as structural, propulsion, suspension, guidance, control, and support that must function together for a system to work effectively.

A67DB5DE6BA146D581D68C3B33A79E51.description: Describe how transporting people and goods involve a combination of individuals and vehicles.

AA9CDBCB81824E3A8BCD821124B15E4F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use transportation technologies.--The student will be able to:

F5178FAA375D4F219C069415524DF94A.description: Use symbols, measurements, and drawings to promote clear communication by providing a common language to express ideas.

BC5D12EFF1934923A4E1524447362D95.description: Consider factors that influence the design of a message, such as the intended audience, medium, purpose, and nature of the message.

F76D6B9112184DCFB003865823906F3E.description: Describe communication systems made up of a source, encoder, transmitter, receiver, decoder, and destination.

1AC88A2CF5CF403B84B0D0BCB73E916B.description: Create information and communication systems that allow information to be transferred from human to human, human to machine, machine to machine, and machine to human.

5C13F9CCBD66444CA0168692615B97D5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use information and communication technologies.--The student will be able to:

4817C59F40384A99BBF8311BA9DCB8D3.description: Explain how much of the energy used in our environment is not used efficiently.

EE361A5F4730468ABE4986AD6F16320C.description: Describe power systems used to drive and provide propulsion to other technological products and systems.

664E4E2142934B37BF66219DBAB5CF67.description: Define power as the rate at which energy is converted from one form to another or transferred from one place to another, or the rate at which work is done.

BA48E305B2284F3C803589534B306713.description: Explain how energy can be used to do work, using many processes.

DFFF109864FA464BB8F8D119DC9314F4.description: Define energy as the capacity to do work.

1BFD4FAFB002445B857E36255E5AFCF2.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use energy and power technologies.--The student will be able to:

709E59BA2AA34D7BB7F62BDADCE269D5.description: Explain how the development of refrigeration, freezing, dehydration, preservation, and irradiation provide long-term storage of food and reduce the health risks caused by tainted food.

63EC325905164A6B952946A85A29B23D.description: Create artificial ecosystems that are human-made complexes that replicate some aspects of natural environments.

9B028D6653FA487199E52756ECCE43C2.description: Explain how biotechnology applies the principles of biology to create commercial products or processes.

698179AE4AFA44B989795C9072C4D4F3.description: Describe how a wide range of specialized equipment and practices is used to improve the production of food, fiber, fuel, and other useful products and in the care of animals.

6F039288FA8E4549B4D0B8813D5A887E.description: Describe technological advances in agriculture directly affecting the time and number of people required to produce food for a large population.

1912036C569B48F4A05D3B27B1F5A725.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use agricultural and related biotechnologies.--The student will be able to:

D8DC93BD273E4876960B2F8D80BD9274.description: Describe genetic engineering involving modifying the structure of DNA to produce novel genetic make-ups.

FAB0F1E4DD304A4FA79F22584CA2FF1F.description: Explain how the vaccines developed for use in immunization require specialized technologies to support environments in which a sufficient amount of vaccines are produced.

7D766518A6B2404E8978E1749E498E29.description: Describe how sanitation processes used in the disposal of medical products help to protect people from harmful organisms and disease, and shape the ethics of medical safety.

3830D6B7C05A4D4180EE400C83BDEB0F.description: Describe how advances and innovations in medical technologies are used to improve healthcare.

375DD44F4D464BB194B16FF2CF35A090.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use medical technologies.--The student will be able to:

CB896B794B9D4BD68A6DB12CD4B094D6.description: Interpret and evaluate the accuracy of the information obtained and determine if it is useful.

3336260105D443BD941BC2E203697630.description: Identify trends and monitor potential consequences of technological development.

9B4981811A544DED8F6414F5440952BD.description: Use data collected to analyze and interpret trends in order to identify the positive or negative effects of a technology.

70BFDA27A29B4894B0774FA9EE2C9DA9.description: Design and use instruments to gather data.

A10AC4575D664214AFE9A0B249280492.description: Demonstrate the abilities to assess the impact of products and systems.--The student will be able to:

A5995D0CAF054C3FA161CAE01419621E.description: Operate and maintain systems in order to achieve a given purpose.

5B320B4037B74866944339D26C3FCE01.description: Use computers and calculators in various applications.

4B4458CA1ED44C3E8876E7A3AA34D16C.description: Use tools, materials, and machines safely to diagnose, adjust, and repair systems.

77297BDB4E034949A579C3E0E9ED211F.description: Use information provided in manuals, protocols, or by experienced people to see and understand how things work.

74BC2C41CF62419CB9426A2C141C84E0.description: Demonstrate the abilities to use and maintain technological products and systems.--The student will be able to:

5C47EB8F978740CDBDFED244222D9887.description: Make a product or system and document the solution.

87DC8256870540BB88D8514E8198E5C4.description: Test and evaluate the design in relation to pre-established requirements, such as criteria and constraints, and refine as needed.

0E55ECE8E5FA4791940F7772FC30F02B.description: Make two-dimensional and three-dimensional representations of the designed solution.

F7DB1D1FC0634B9E8DE3B3CAD5C9E390.description: Specify criteria and constraints for the design.

EA187BFB24EE428F97E91B5AEF805790.description: Apply a design process to solve problems in and beyond the laboratory-classroom.

FC0D5CC87C7E4B469C640566361F5497.description: Demonstrate the abilities to apply the design process.--The student will be able to:

16C1D3C7762E49CEA4C138736F0532F9.description: Identify technological problems that are best solved through experimentation.

D47A318925004F1B8860F93EF7EDA306.description: Describe invention as a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and innovation as the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it.

59C148EDA83F4545A8C0977D57D98696.description: Use troubleshooting as a problem-solving method used to identify the cause of a malfunction in a technological system.

28C187F3440A4493A83E897B5603BD36.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of troubleshooting, research and development, invention and innovation, and experimentation in problem solving.--The student will be able to:

B339D28E3F204C8EA449F79C14ABEC23.description: Model, test, evaluate and modify designs to transform ideas into practical solutions.

DBB4B5C40DC248BCA74CC40603AD8101.description: Employ brainstorming as a group problem-solving design process in which each person in the group presents his or her ideas in an open forum.

B316BA087C8B47E8B29F941C66FFBF62.description: Utilize the design process involving a set of steps, which can be performed in different sequences and repeated as needed.

6A3B97F593DB45E589EDD1B75622E06D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of engineering design.--The student will be able to:

1EE35B1383254A00B63198C9642B9AB7.description: Demonstrate the ability to properly identify different resources used in projects.

1C8226629C3D4B65B0430F5E4CFBB56C.description: Evaluate criteria and constraints that are requirements for a design.

9DEC2A467FA14849BE2B5BC6BF5E1E5E.description: Explain why there is no perfect design.

5787DF3D20964CD2BD21BE4F61FE1748.description: Use design as a creative planning process that leads to useful products and systems.

6251A95738A04B2F90FADE8779873BB4.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the attributes of design.--The student will be able to:

0C4EE29A1C1C424497E6EFD8DF823648.description: Investigate how, that in the past, an invention or innovation was not usually developed with the knowledge of science.

25289DC24A814B0E82F5BA52FB652739.description: Identify how the design and construction of structures for service or convenience evolving from the development of techniques for measurement, controlling systems, and the understanding of spatial relationships.

A354F7B77571437ABE1F3CA90665AFFD.description: Explain how the specialization of function has been at the heart of many technological improvements.

9D5B1E8C250341489C57877E2C8E6ECE.description: Identify inventions and innovations that have evolved by using slow and methodical processes of tests and refinements.

4339E7C136364D15A66A9461B1139612.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the influence of technology on history.--The student will be able to:

D0024B3BA0F94F5C903EE529AD47255D.description: Explain how meeting societal expectations is the driving force behind the acceptance and use of products and systems.

8C493F97F2D7436A973AB43BFB41D134.description: Understand social and cultural priorities and values that are reflected in technological devices.

D07BF71698EC41D188F23848FA7B8243.description: Describe changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants caused by the use of inventions and innovations.

DF887B1412A640BBA31823A8B33E3B01.description: Describe the development of technologies that has resulted from the demands, values, and interests of individuals, businesses, industries, and societies.

3C52CC72E513462285166C5D07E3B9CD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of society in the development and use of technology.--The student will be able to:

A30F94E8DAEB4521AE5986E5E3082FA6.description: Make decisions about the development and use of technologies that put environmental and economic concerns in direct competition with one another.

D6AE53E6808441EAB2C021A86FB9CAA7.description: Describe how technologies can be used to repair damage caused by natural disasters and to break down waste from the use of various products and systems.

76FE4CC1B2A149D78BE6984065B2F020.description: Describe the management of waste produced by technological systems as an important societal issue.

9EA8D36AF4AA4AA1925060D37D7F0F41.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the effects of technology on the environment.--The student will be able to:

DCD56BE9C33F460CBBC542E31C5158D7.description: Identify the economic, political, and cultural issues that are influenced by the development and use of technology.

317263283D134532B00D1CD38B75106A.description: Identify ethical issues associated with the development and use of technology.

B9D73DA676AA4B7B99FB16E4D929F567.description: Explain that technology, by itself, is neither good nor bad; but decisions about the use of products and systems can result in desirable or undesirable consequences.

5CD036F00C1E4EEA8B2146FA457684F9.description: Identify the ways that use of technology affects humans, including their safety, comfort, choices, and attitudes about technology’s development and use.

EA68EFDBBE4540FD849078ECC7A05366.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the cultural, social, economic, and political effects of technology.--The student will be able to:

1293BC273AB84F3093FC13749D3541E2.description: Explain how knowledge gained from other fields of study has a direct effect on the development of technological products and systems.

BDCBC708E235448C999F5B7994D4B954.description: Apply a product, system, or environment developed for one setting in another setting.

91F0233B0C914A2ABF026BCA62BA7666.description: Modify the way technological systems interact with one another.

95C7EFD397D54F6FA312F5D866EAEF60.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships among technologies and the connection between technology and other fields of study.--The student will be able to:

1D0160D2DE4C4369BCB19CD024BCB59E.description: Utilize controls and mechanisms or particular steps that people perform using information about the system that causes systems to change.

556D3D71F3F345CB875D8121A8DA59DE.description: Perform basic maintenance as the process of inspecting and servicing a product or system on a regular basis in order for it to continue functioning properly, to extend its life, or to upgrade its capability.

283C1BC2764A45E0A973F69866FC87DC.description: Describe different technologies that involve different sets of processes.

B6FC60A8AA224306B2A16EEBD6C0FB70.description: Compare and contrast trade-offs as a decision process recognizing the need for careful compromises among competing factors.

8A37FAF4B5CF49F4AF7863BEE6DEAC1C.description: Compare and contrast requirements or parameters placed on the development of a product or system.

6AA8E1FC813B4399825C89BB8B105728.description: Repair malfunctions of any part of a system that may affect the function and quality of the system.

4CCF9754F83640A1B7A6BA0F132D4279.description: Explain how technological systems can be connected to one another.

A5B532E02CF94A3B80E3664D838C30EA.description: Identify control systems having no feedback path and requiring human intervention, and control systems using feedback.

66EA17C2423745A48D47B41FABDA142D.description: Apply systems thinking, involving considering how every part relates to others.

F5F0B742C6834890905DC4FF533B350E.description: Describe technological systems including input, processes, output, and, at times, feedback.

E1C13B06CDA24E35BF3F6B9DE2E63E8D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the core concepts of technology.--The student will be able to:

0E8555992BF44960AAF20D961285D72F.description: Demonstrate how corporations can often create demand for a product by bringing it onto the market and advertising it.

98E93380F31E43CCB46872531BCAC720.description: Explain how technology is closely linked with creativity, which has resulted in innovation.

1B8099615A734677A3B9DD458A1176BF.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.

CFDB0B1A3DF648529A34CE1BE73E35FC.description: Develop new products and systems to solve problems or to help do things that could not be done without the help of technology.

7F0C12DD68EC4F809E219B30397C236E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics and scope of technology.--The student will be able to:
